person.persName: Samuel B. Pell (Hancock farmer and sheriff)

body.p: A Virginia-born, Kentucky farmer and sheriff. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Sarah Pell. Father of Thomas J. Pell, W. C. Pell, and S. B. Pell, Jr. Served as sheriff of Hancock County in 1854 and 1864. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1855 to 1857. One of the founders of the Lewisport Pond Draining Company in 1858. Murdered in August 1864, while serving as sheriff of Hancock County.
